Reviews.Title: “Incredible front desk, vibrant area”
Reviews.Author: EliseNY
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room facing the water and had such a great time at this hotel. The attached restaurant was convenient and the hotel lounge had a great breakfast and was a nice place to relax. The staff were beyond helpful and so nice. This is a busy and clubby area with a lot of boat activity. If you want real quiet, pick a different part of town, but we loved every minute of it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a difference”
Reviews.Author: marwan9
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent 4 days in Istanbul at the beginning of April and chose the House Hotel for its location and also for having balconies facing the Bosphorous. We were nicely surprised at how helpful the staff was in making our stay as memorable as possible. Every restaurant they suggested was above our expectations, their service was exceptional and well above what any employee will do, walking with us to taxis, making sure we were well taken care of by outside services. Also we had the chance to meet the Manager of the establishment, what a Lady! hands on service with a smile and the most friendly person ever! Definitely this hotel was well worth the money, will go there again and should be sugeested to any person visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Pampering at the House Hotel Bosporus”
Reviews.Author: Kate B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a fabulous 4 nights in the comfort of House Hotel over Easter. The hotel management and team could not have been more charming or helpful who went out of their way to suggest restaurants, help with travel/logistics etc. We were extremely lucky to stay in the Simon Kalfa Suite which is on the top floor with windows and balcony on three sides overlooking Bosphorus - an astonishing view to wake up to each morning. So a beautiful setting. The room was very comfortable with a well stocked bar, Nespresso machine and lots of accessible electric sockets! The gym is small but air conditioned and feels brand new. The breakfast was delcious and the hotel is surrounded by some extraordinarily good restaurants for evening meals eg Zuma. The boat trip up the Bosphorus to fort and fishing village was busy but fun. Dinner at the Galata Tower was v entertaining! Just the place to go to for a romantic break

Reviews.Title: “The best manager”
Reviews.Author: mirella26
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based onTrip Advisor Reviews. Although the room was smaller than we had expected - features are at a very high level and has the classic architecture of a 19th century palace. My favourite is the hotel's wonderful lounge room with views over the Bosphorus -and they serve an excellent breakfast . The staff were brilliantly helpful in particular the manager who gave us excellent recommendations and made us feel at home - she could not have been more helpful. Ortakoy appears to be a very hip area- surrounded by clubs which may be the only drawback if you are looking for peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect honeymoon ;)”
Reviews.Author: E-BOURCIER
Reviews.Content: We had great time last April in Istanbul and thanks to The House Hotel we were very comfortable. We preferred The House Hotel to spend our 10th anniversary and the delicate attentions of the management and kind service of the staff made us feel like our first honeymoon. The location of the hotel is just magic overseeing Bosphorus. Even we were already knowing The House CafÃ© and going regularly everytime we were in Istanbul, it was our first stay in The House Hotel but definitely not the last ;) - Couple from Paris

Reviews.Title: “Luxury boutique hotel with a great view of the Bosphorus sea”
Reviews.Author: Jemich
Reviews.Content: The House hotel is a lovely small boutique hotel with modern luxurious decor, right in the middle of the busy Ortakoy waterfront area. I got upgraded to a deluxe suite, which has an excellent view of the sea and bustling restaurant/bar scene in the area. The room is very tastefully decked out and comes with a Nespresso machine and L'Occitane toiletries. I fell in love with the room - 403! Service is excellent, very attentive guest relations officers. There are also a number of nice restaurants in that area e.g. Feriye, Zuma, etc.... The biggest setback for me is I could hear the loud music playing from the nearby restaurants and bars at night (with windows shut), which will be a problem for light sleepers. The small road into Ortakoy is also constantly jammed, plus not accessible via tram or train station, so it can be challenging to get out of the area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: MissBabblicious
Reviews.Content: What can I possibly say that hasn't already been said? This review will sound like a broken record of all the other reviews but there is a reason why. The House Hotel is exactly that- your home away from home. That is if you live in the home of the architects that designed the Dolmabahce Palace. The hotel itself is GORGEOUS! If you want a huge sprawling hotel, this is not the place for you. This was literally the house of a famous architectural family and you can see it in all the detailing of the hotel and rooms. Due to some noise that was NOT under the control of the hotel, we were upgraded to the Bosphorus Suite. And what an upgrade it was. This suite has 2 balconies, both which look out onto the Bosphorus. The downside is that the cute little balcony with a small table and chairs and the breathtaking views makes it VERY hard to want to leave the room. We actually nixed a ferry tour so that we could just relax on the balcony. Besides the beautiful detailing in the rooms, the interior decorating is also very charming. My favorite was the bedside lamp that looks like a golden birdcage. It's details like this that make me fall in love with certain hotels. And my favorite part of the rooms- L'Occitane bath products. Sold! That's when I knew everything in this hotel was luxurious. In addition, they provide complimentary bottles of water and my favorite, complimentary brunch. The brunch is located in their library with more amazing views. The food is great with lots of options. The perfect way to start your morning. As for location, it couldn't be any better. You have the most amazing view of the Bosphorus Bridge. Watching it change colors at night was amazing. You are also in walking distance of tons of restaurants, shops and ferry tours. If you are looking to go to do touristy stuff, it is an easy 30 min walk (or quick bus ride) to the Dolmabahce Palace or the Metro which takes you right to old town. Super easy. You are also about a 45 min walk to Bebek which is an adorable little waterfront town to the north. And I had to save the best part for last. What really made The House such a memorable stay was the service. Bahar, the manager, came to greet us when we were done with breakfast. She introduced herself and apologized for the noise (which wasn't their fault). She told us she was changing our room so we were farther away from the noise. She also sent us a bottle of wine and made sure everything was perfect from then on out. Her and her staff were all so helpful and friendly, we were sad to go to the next hotel. She was so great that When we had a terrible experience at the next hotel (Le Meridien Etiler), I emailed her and she was able to get us a room at her sister hotel, The House Hotel Nisantasi. I can't wait to go back to Istanbul and even more, I can't wait to stay at The House Hotel Bosphorus and see Bahar!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel w/ Fabulous Staff”
Reviews.Author: mouniratassi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Istanbul for our Honeymoon. The city is wonderful. We stayed in the House Hotel Bosphorus for three nights. We had a truly outstanding experience at the House Hotel. When we arrived at the hotel, we just fell in love with the hotel and its wonderful staff. The staff were always pleasant, always smiling, always helpful. The view from our room was breathtaking, over the Bosphorus and the bridge. We had a lovely Balcony. The room was specious and very nicely decorated. There was fresh water in the room each day for us, nice comfortable robes, slippers and a nice marble bathroom with a great rain shower and Lâ€™Occitane bathroom amenities. The room also had a safe for keeping valuables. The breakfast was excellent. Delicious Turkish food with a wonderful view over the Bosphorus. I could stay in the breakfast hall for hours. The OrtakÃ¶y area where the hotel is located is very lively area with amazing restaurants, cafes, the Bosphorus bridge and we can take a Bosphorus tour outside the hotel. You can have a lovely walk or sit on a pinch and watch enjoy the view any-time of the day. We had the chance to watch the new year's eve celebration from our balcony. OrtakÃ¶y area was full of people celebrating and having fun. We watched the fireworks from our room, we really enjoyed watching the celebration from our room without getting wet (it was raining that night). If go back to Istanbul I would stay in this hotel again, definitely. Finally, thanks House Hotel for making my Honeymoon very exceptional experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: ricardo m
Reviews.Content: It is not easy to find such an excellent staff, such a marvellous Hotel Manager and such a lovely place on the Bosphorus. We had a very, very great time and will recommend this hotel to my friends and family. Very good breakfast and magnificent views.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ameerah77
Reviews.Content: Lovely setting on the bosphorus, friendly staff, loved the room design. Would recommend it, and i would come back again. I have to mention the doormen are really helpful in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, incredible staff, best place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Dana W
Reviews.Content: I agree 100% with everyone on here that the staff is exceptional at this hotel. It was a major reason why I chose this hotel in the first place but I was overwhelmed with how professional and helpful everyone was. They made you feel as though they valued your business, they called you by your first name, they were always smiling and helpful with reservations. We had no itinerary when we arrived in Istanbul and the staff helped us figure out what to do, see and where to eat. They were incredible, I can't say it enough. The hotel itself is stylish, clean, hip and modern. I loved the aesthetic. I am a big snob when it comes to cleanliness with hotels and I found this hotel to be completely up to par. The breakfast was good and the beautiful dining room overlooks the bosphorus. I would return to Istanbul just to stay at this hotel, I liked it that much. Make sure to meet Bahar, the general manager. She is such a lovely person!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service”
Reviews.Author: miamibeacher
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of days in February. Loved the room and the view of the Bosphorus. The Manager, Bahar, was one of the best hotel managers we have met. She was very helpful and friendly. Her restaurant recommendations were flawless and we particularly enjoyed one called Luna, which was about 2 miles from the hotel. We did encounter a problem one night when the City of Istanbul sponsored a concert in the plaza next to the hotel. The hotel was not responsible and the staff was very understanding that we could not stay in the room because of the loud music. They paid for our taxi ride to another hotel and even sent a bottle of wine. They also sent us apology notes. I am not sure how many hotels would do that. It was truly first class and above what we expected. We were very sorry we could not stay in the hotel on our last night, but we will return the next time we are in Istanbul. I highly recommend this hotel and their other hotels/cafes based on their dedication to service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, lovely staff and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: monak5
Reviews.Content: Just came back from house hotel bosphoros and i have to say that it was an excellent experience, bahar the general manager is excellent and such a lovely person, not only helpful and makes sure that you have all your needs met, she is a very sweet lady to chat with. the hotel is lovely, overlooking the bosphors in ortakoy. the room we stayed in was very nice, it had a balcony but a bit small in space i must say. But then again i am fussy when it comes to room size, as i do like my space. the breakfast room was perfect with the waiters being so attentive and nice and didnt mind if you wanted to take something to your room. So, in short i have to say that this hotel was home away from home and its due to its staff, as you know you can be staying at the most luxurious hotel but if the staff are not as expected, the whole experience becomes a bad experience. whereas when you are in a hotel with such lovely staff and management, the small things (like a smallish room) wont matter whatsoever. Keep up the excellent work bahar and team Mrs. Bustani, Bahrain

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulus !!!”
Reviews.Author: Alex K
Reviews.Content: The Hotel's people were serius professionals and their experience helped us to enjoy a very pleasant stay. The rooms were with exellent view to Bosphorus channel and Bridge , day and night, also very clean and with all the comforts you may need. The spot is very good (you are not far from the center, but far enough in order not to disturb you with noise,crowd etc.) also the local "sea Bus" stop is in front of the Hotel, witch is very useful for Instabul's traffic "stuck" at the rush hours. At the Hotel the brekfast is exellent and is served with sea view... We defenetly come again and we think is highly recommended !!! Alp - Bahar thank you again you are absolutely fabulus... Alexandros - Katerina

Reviews.Title: “Just amazing”
Reviews.Author: Silvia H
Reviews.Content: one of the most memorable stays in a long time. Excellent location: next to the Bosphorus. Old town is very easy to get to by bus and tram. Hotel: newly opened (june 2011). Interior design with a lot of attention to detail and taste. But what made this stay so memorable is the staff: Bahar Karaca, the hotel's manager, makes you very welcome and makes sure your stay is memorable. The staff is very friendly and always able to answer all your questions. Overall, a thoroughly enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: jad00007
Reviews.Content: the best hotel ever , the best view , the best service, the best interior design, excellent staff we where treated in a very personalized way , the veiw from the breakfast is so beautifull..... everything was just perfect...

Reviews.Title: “A dream”
Reviews.Author: Mona D
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin to tell the story of my stay in this hotel?? .. from the beautifully decorated hotel, to the amazing Bosphorus view from the breakfast room , to the delicious selection of Brerakast food from non traditional to traditional turkish, to the beautiful suite we had with the breathtaking view of the Ortakoy Mosque and the Bosphorus...and the highlight of all this was the extremely professional and amazingly kind staff who did everything to make our stay a great one. Being treated that way made us feel unique and as if we were the only guests . I wish I remember all the names but Alp and Matin were the stars in making our stay one of the best ! As for Bahar, the manager of the Hotel , she is by far the best hotel manager I have ever come across in my very frequent travels around the world. Mona from Beirut

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN ISTANBUL”
Reviews.Author: keeponmoooovin
Reviews.Content: The House Hotel is a wonderful place to stay. As a business traveller, I travel all over the world and have stayed in 100's of hotels and I can honestly say that this is one of the best I have stayed in. The decoration of the hotel building, rooms and lounge bar is chic, stylish and combines traditional turkish themes with modern Istanbul and was a very comfortable place to stay. The scented pillow the bed was unique and welcomed after a long trip. The food was delicious, a turkish breakfast that was plentiful, fresh and well presented, enjoyed in the lounge bar with incredible views of the busy Bosphorus is a must! And finally the service from the hotel manager, reception staff and porters was excellent, all of them really dedicated to perfection. The general awareness for the value of good service is definitely a huge priority in the hotel and all employees clearly enjoy working at the hotel and take pride their jobs and are happy to be there. This hotel is new and is very charming, perfectly sized, hidden away in the perfect location on the water and is defineitly somewhere I would not hesitate recommending. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back tomorrow!”
Reviews.Author: Shelley L
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed with my boyfriend for New Year's eve and had a really wonderful stay at the House Hotel Bosphorus. The hotel is beautifully situated along the Bosphrous and in the coolest part of Istanbul, though it's not far to walk to the night life, the hotel is quite and serene with excellent service. Bahar the general manager is a gem and was so helpful in organizing our visit. The suite was beautiful and had a gorgeous view of the Ortakoy mosque, my favorite in Istanbul. All in all, a great choice for a stay in Istanbul, any season. I'd go back tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “a Turkish delight!”
Reviews.Author: Louise B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 days in Turkey 2 weeks ago . Part of this experience was staying at the House Hotel on the Bosphorus which was for us home from home. We were welcomed by the friendly and helpful staff who attended to our every need from advice where to eat and places to visit , the best way possible in Turkey. The room was beautifully appointed with fresh linen and complimentary eats. The view was spectacular and i can only imagine how charming it must be in summer with the spectacular views of the Bosphurus from the intimate dining room where we had breakfast. The situation of the hotel is in a vibey area for those who enjoy dining with music and atmosphere of istanbul's Turkish delight. Regards Louise and Mike (South Africa)

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca G
Reviews.Content: cool cosy hotel in a great location if the Bospherous is what you want to wake up to. Service excellent and Bahar the hotel manager takes care of all the guests extremely well.

Reviews.Title: “Bliss by the Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: James C
Reviews.Content: This was without question one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. Though Boutique, this size and warmth of the welcome are overwhelming. We were made to feel at home from the very first minute. The quality and presentation of the rooms complemented the service from the staff. Having booked late, we only managed to secure a back room with no view of the Bosphorus itself. However, judging by the view form the room, the Sea facing rooms must be spectacular - for choice - that is what we would go for next time. Details such as the complementary water and snacks and the generous breakfast all go towards making the stay even more enjoyable. The hotel is in a very buzzy area, next door to Zuma - there is plenty of fun to be had within walking distance. The rooms are all very stylish and modern, with a good deal of thought having been given to luxury in the bathroom. If you are planning to make the most of your time in Istanbul, the staff of the hotel are great at arranging activities and excursions - we would particularly recommend the private boat tour of the Bosphorus and the Turkish baths. All in all, a superb hotel where their objective is to make everyone feel at home. Given its location and style, it feels like it is a "too cool for school" hotel. However, we have never been made to feel more welcome nor been so sorry to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Your tres chic house in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MadrasGiaguari
Reviews.Content: January 1st, 2012 Think to be thousands of miles far from home, last day of the year, while your relatives and friends celebrate that magÄ±c yearly event. Think about a fake party in a fake standardized ''international'' hotel. Think about foreign peoples who don't care of you.... Well. If you think that, you are NOT at House Hotel Bosphorus! At House Hotel Bosphorus Mrs. Bahar Karaca, greatest hotel manager and hostess I may recall, and her fantastic team (specÄ±al mention to the very patient and competent concierges Alp Tunaliberberler and Erdal; to Mustafa, who made breakfast a magic moment every morning), do more than their best to make your stay very pleasant. Istanbul is an extraordinary interesting and colorfull city. But it is so relaxÄ±ng to start your day at the hotel lounge and have your sumptuous breakfast in a finely decorated hall with fireplace, nice books and magazines, and mainly a breathtaking view over the Bosphorus (the hotel is just on the water, and you can take a whater taxi for an amazing ride till the old town, bypassing the crazy traffÄ±c of the roads) havÄ±ng around smiling waiters (the same day of your arrÄ±val you will feel to have known for years Mustafa). Same home feeling when you get back to the hotel at the end of a busy day in Sulthanhamet. The Hotel is happly located in the lively area of the Mosque of Ortakoy, full of little shops and restaurants, very animated every night, the ideal for a pleasant walk wÄ±thout need of taking a taxi. More, you should notice that this Bosphorus side hosts the best historical hotels, as Les Ottomans and Ciragan Palace. Also the Imperial palace of Dolmabace is nearby. That tells a lot about the beauty of the location. I won't tell about the rooms and their unÄ±que design: that will be another nice surprise. Thank you, Bahar

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: verabounti
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel for our wedding in Istanbul in December. I have nothing but romantic memories thanks to the location and ambience of the hotel. Moreover one could not ask for a better hotel manager than Miss Bahar who made us feel as the house hotel was our home on the Bosphorus! The stuff was discrete yet joyful and of course the rooms were excellent just what we needed for a romantic weekend! I could not be more pleased with my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need and more”
Reviews.Author: Dana M
Reviews.Content: Beautiful views overlooking The Bosphorous, very nice rooms, feels like a big house, this the name, House Hotel. The manager, Bahar and the head man behind the desk were FANTASTIC. Genuinely interested in our plans, helping us get everywhere including a big football game. We loved the location on the water with a more residential/local life and shops in the neighborhood yet Starbucks and Burger King are next door. We took a water taxi to the main sights which was expensive but a perfect way to start. Otherwise, it is 20-30 minutes to the Tourist Sights, which we didn't mind at all (taxi, tram and walking). I recommend this hotel highly. They are top notch, more boutique and have that special personal attention that makes such a difference. Good food too.

Reviews.Title: “A charming experience!”
Reviews.Author: Clark V
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were informed that the manager had taken the liberty to upgrade us as a token of appreciation because we were staying for 6 nights - a wonderful way to begin our trip. We felt very well taken care of throughout our stay. All the staff were very friendly & helpful. A special nod to the General Manager Bahar, who, in addition to the upgrade, went out of her way to provide us with excellent restaurant recommendations & helpful tips, and Concierge Alp who always greeted us with a smile & attentive service:) We loved coming back to the hotel after a day's sightseeing to enjoy a turkish coffee in the House Cafe with spectacular water views & warm ambiance. All in all a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to be!”
Reviews.Author: PascaleAbiYounes
Reviews.Content: Warm,brand new boutique hotel...very relaxing atmosphere,suitable for all kind of trips, business, leisure,romance...Prime location,with breathtaking view!The House is the place to stay when visiting Istanbul. Friendly, welcoming and knowledgeable staff, comfy stylish rooms, you feel you do not want to leave anymore! I got the chance to meet with the hotel manager Ms. Bahar,extremly amazing lady, a great example of luxurious hospitality and terrific assistance and recommendations. Thank you all, and see you again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Choice for Istanbul; Outstanding Staff”
Reviews.Author: DCTravelFan100
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the House Hotel Bosphorus. First and foremost, the staff is uniformly terrific 24/7 -- very helpful, very nice. It is a boutique hotel, located in a renovated residence, so the rooms will very in size. My room was small, but charming with a very comfortable king bed. The bathroom/shower area was excellent with outstanding toiletries. My greatest concern with the room was the serious lack of storage space -- there was no closet and no real bureau space. There was a relatively small valet piece from which to hang clothes and on which to place a small piece of luggage; this was the only space for clothes and this same piece also contained a safe and (if I recall corectly) a mini-fridge. Other than this one small piece, the only option was to put luggage on the floor. I was alone in the room and made it work, but if I was sharing the room, there would not have been comfortable space for two people, two sets of suitcases, etc. I loved the location of the hotel -- Ortakoy is nice respite from the center of Istanbul, but still within easy tram or cab reach. And Ortakoy has nice shops and a bazaar, with good restaurants nearby. The hotel itself is well situated in Ortakoy, overlooking the Bosphorus and next to restaurants, bars and the Ortakoy bazaar. Breakfast, which is quite good, is served in a lovely room and adjoining terrace area with Bosphorus views. As other reviewers have noted, there is quite an active bar scene at the hotel and so, if you are noise sensitive, that may be a concern. However, my room was on the "bar side," overlooking the Bosphorus and I did not find the noise a problem. All in all, this is a very good choice, albeit a not inexpensive choice -- but the great staff, location and overall feel make it an extremely worthwhile hotel option.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel - but not without watch-outs”
Reviews.Author: fhpete
Reviews.Content: Lots of positives here for sure: The location can't be beaten, the design is clean and fresh, food is great and the staff is super attentive and ready to take care of you from arrival to departure. Other reviewers have complained about the staff and I have no idea what they are talking about. The bed is super comfortable and housekeeping staff know what they're doing and room amenities are everything you need for a comfortable stay. On the neutral side: This is a boutique hotel so rooms are small....and they don't apologize for that. I booked a superior room with a king bed. I think this is their lowest category room. It is just larger than the King bed, no closet - so your clothes are hanging beside you while you sleep. Views from this category are also limited. The nightly noise in some other reviews is real with a bar that beats out base till the wee hours of the night. Not a big deal - but if you demand silence when you sleep, its a watch-out. The bathroom is beautifully designed, but again - small. I was on the first floor and heard the flush of toilets above me throughout the room. Water temperature fluctuated radically while I showered. This was an apartment building before it was a hotel (I'm told), so perhaps the old plumbing accounts for this. Overall, I will give this hotel another chance in a future trip (based on location and staff) - but likely in a higher category to take advantage of the amazing views.

Reviews.Title: “the BEST VIEWS with the BEST FOOD!”
Reviews.Author: rodolfo3200
Reviews.Content: ARRIVAL: Having arrived in Istanbul already knowing the city I didnâ€™t expect a hotel to give me a new perspective to it, I must say, The House Hotel Bosphorus was such a pleasant surprise!!! When I first got there Mr. Alp and his staff made me feel so welcome that the check in seemed to take a couple of seconds just! The hotel has the best location in Ortakoy, cozy, sunny and brand new!!! STAFF: The staff of The House Hotel is what makes a difference, the name of the hotel chain says it all, you feel at home. The team introduced itself upon the arrival as well as the whole staff efforts themselves to make sure youâ€™re always satisfied and enjoying your best of the hotel. The food is the high point, the breakfast seemed more like lunch, everything included, INCLUDING the awesome Bosphorus view with its sunkissed waters. I must also congratulate again Mr. Alp and his front desk staff, the BEST of Istanbul. Also Mr. Aysegul deserves my compliments on helping me arrange my stay and clearing every doubt, as well as Mr. Antony Doucet who was very helpful as well when I was deciding to stay at The House Hotel, and of course Ms. Pinar of Marketing/PR and Bahar, all very kind and welcoming. HOTEL/LOCATION: The location is amazing for either relax or tourism: OrtakÃ¶y! Where else? It is the place to be for young couples, also business meetings and even family getaways. Having the whole market at your feet The House Hotel puts you in a privileged area with stunning Bosphorus views. The hotel has a series of restaurants, one rooftop and one bordering the river, included in its building, as well as the best club of Istanbul for the Summer, the Angelique, is also right there, Zuma Japanese restaurant is right on the corner and the staff is VERY helpful, arranging the best deals with taxis and all kinds of transportation, I mean all kinds because you can easily use watertaxi too in Istanbul! OVERALL: Looking for a welcoming place to stay in Istanbul? Try one of The House Hotels, it has some properties in the city and having visited the OrtakÃ¶y one I felt so welcome by Mr. Alp, Mr. Aysegul and their staff that I am already anxious to visit the other branches of the hotel in my next travels, there is one at Nisantase which is an upscale shopping district that feels specially interesting too, but for a first time and the gorgeous view the answer is already given: The House Hotel Bosphorus is the very BEST when it comes to a design experience in Istanbul, be it for shopping (House Hotel Nisantase) or tourism and typical experience (House Hotel OrtakÃ¶y).

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Khaled_R
Reviews.Content: Very very disappointing. Poor staff quality at the reception. 1- the room was extremely hot with no control on the AC. Could not stay or sleep in the room. After 24 hours, and several complaints the only solution was to change in a smaller room with very bad view and the same rate 2- Despite having booked for 3 rooms, and despite the fact that the rate for 1 single person is the same as for 2 people, i had to negotiate hardly to get a late check out for free for 1 of the rooms. 3- on top of all the above they have charged me 40Euros extra by mistake. The only good thing of this hotel is the lively location next to top retaurants and clubs (Zuma, Angelique, Reina, Supper Club..). Far from the old town for those that would like to spend time visiting the amazing mosques and museums (sokkolu, rustem pasha, sultanahmet, hagia sofia, topkapi, islamic art museum, basilic cistern, archeological museum, tiles Museum, bazars..).

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: nuniabusiness
Reviews.Content: Not on the tourist trail but a place to find some space to get breath in the crush of a city. You are just on the fringe and can jump a cab to most good places with ease, failing horrid traffic. The house brand has 3, one in the glamour district, one on the high street all with associated cafe/bars that are international food that is terrible by turkish standards but I could not work out if they sub let the bars and keep the hotel business. The hotel was great the 'House"bar/cafe so so. Ortakoy has a little night market a few cafes and bars and a sushi restaurant all dressed to kill just up from the hotel. dash up the road to the Les Ottomans hotel for a hamam in style shared by the worlds A listers if that is your thang, or the pumping bars in summer on the Bosphorus or the Castle just upriver are all great, I here.. we arrived to cool late autumn so chilled out on our 5 honeymoon -oh-ah I do love her so.. next to the disco bridge to remind you there is no accounting for taste this little hotel is a groovy bolt hole with a fine manager in Bahar Karaca. She is hot and will sort you out for were to eat and go and get concierge to book it. Everything she booked was so very good. She maybe why this place is so good. Our room was the Baylin suite, at ear level to the mosque. If you have a liking for something out of the way, but in the middle of everything then do stay here. It has a vibe about the area so expect a few revellers outside Breakfast at the inhouse bar restaurant was great and dinner one night was really good. It was fresh and yum, turkish without being too 'euro-continental' and the rooms quirky maybe should have a player for Ipods, but who care out the door are jazz clubs. Otakoy is OK with me.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: daniru
Reviews.Content: i booked a suite at hotel on 1th-4th november : suite n. 102 at first floor. The first day the heating didn't work in the room and at 11pm started works to refurbish the bar at ground floor under my suite. The noisy was terrible. I called conceirge and they send my in another room at third floor just for sleeping. On the 2th morning I asked if the works were finished and they told YES. Now is 1 am of 3th and they are again working with heavy machines in the bar; I will call Police if they don't stop. Daniela Russo.

Reviews.Title: “An hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: FlyingDutch010
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for a week at the neighbours of this hotel, but after taking a breakfast in the morning into this boutique hotel with only 20 rooms, I was convinced to change my hotel with immidtiate effect. (ofcourse I checked first if i was not being charged with a penalty fee). The rooms are nice (make sure you have the partly Bosphorous view with balcony) and was equipped with an nespresso cofee equipment. The rooms are decorated by a designer, but unfortunatly there is a lack of storage space. Free wifi available and below there is a nice cafe with reatuarnt with excellent dishes and drinks. (nice bar to hang out as well). The female manager of the hotel is realy enjoying her work and is giving tips about places to see or hints of the menu to enjoy for breakfast. Furthermore accoss the street is a pleasant jazz club. Next time I will go again to this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, unforgettable stay at the House Hotel Bosphorous - we loved it !!”
Reviews.Author: joe_and_ayse
Reviews.Content: On our second trip to Istanbul we stayed at the House Hotel Bosphorous in early October 2011 and had an amazing and unforgettable stay there. I stumbled across the hotel on google after searching for a hotel room with a balcony overlooking the Bosphorous and was not disappointed by our stay. Like other travellers who have reviewed the hotel, i travel regularly and have stayed in places all around the world and i was genuinely super impressed by the attitude of all hotel staff who made us feel welcome and went out of their way to ensure we had the best holiday possible. Their advice and recommendations were really spot on. We loved the design of the hotel as much as the position on the Bosphorous and every morning enjoyed a late breakfast watching the ships silently pass by and the sun bounce off the water. We liked the fact that the hotel was such a short walk from other bars and restaurants (Anjelique, Reina, Zuma) We will never forget our first stay at the House Hotel Bosphorous and we are certain we will go back in the coming years on future trips to Istanbul ! Joe and Ayse from London

Reviews.Title: “A delight on the Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: cd_uk79
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first visit to Istanbul and greatly enjoyed our stay here. The building has been beautifully renovated and enjoys an outstanding position affording wonderful views of the Bosphorus. The rooms are cleverly and stylishly designed but short on clothes storage space - tho' I understand this shortcoming is being addressed. Good shower but bathroom should provide a little more surface space. High standard of cleanliness. Complimentary coffee and water in room a definite plus. Very willing and always pleasant staff. Very good breakfast served in a very light and airy room with terrific view. Although music from nearby establishments can sometimes be heard, we were well warned by the Manager and despite being ancient it caused us no problems. A very welcoming & relaxing place to stay. 2 UK oldies.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, warm welcome & beautiful views!”
Reviews.Author: Ramiro V
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful experience to stay at The House Hotel â€“ Bosphorus. The hotel staff is attentive, warm and welcoming, but that was my experience throughout Istanbul. Bahar, the hotel manager, made the stay at the hotel like icing on a cake. She personally introduced herself and went out of her way to plan and make arrangements for us. Her suggestions were right on the mark, and she truly made us feel at home. The view of the Bosphorus from the hotel is worldclass, and the hotel is conveniently located near great restaurants and nightclubs. My only regret is not coming sooner! I will highly endorse this beautiful gem of a hotel to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing week in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ScottChicago25
Reviews.Content: We just spent an amazing week in the beautiful city of Istanbul and our stay at the House Hotel Bosphorous was definitely a highlight of our vacation. Ortakoy is an beautiful area in Istanbul that overlooks the Bosphorous and the world famous mosque. It sits just north of downtown Istanbul but i loved the fact that it was a bit removed from the craziness of the city. The hotel staff is OUTSTANDING!!! We have traveled all over the world and have stayed at beautiful boutique hotels and i can tell you that this hotel is truly the BEST place that we have ever stayed. The General Manager Bahar is THE BEST! The recommendations that she gave us were spot on and we feel we were really able to see Istanbul from a local perspective rather than a tourist perspective. The front desk staff was fantastic, always helping to set us up with a taxi, directions, etc. Names escape me but one of the bellboys walked into town with us and helped us buy a transportation pass at a local store in Ortakoy - that kind of service is very rare and really sets the hotel apart. The restaurant/lounge is wonderful - we had breakfast on the terrace every morning and i can't tell you how great it was to start our day in that beautiful location/environment. And the staff in the restaurant was always friendly and very attentive. Our room at the House Hotel Bosphourous was very nice. I had some concerns before we arrived because people had been bothered by the noise but we did not find that to be a problem at all. We did use a sound machine at night ( an iphone application that we use all the time ) so that we didn't hear the call to prayer at 545am and it worked wonders. The rooms were beautiful - loved all the attention to detail that they provided. We love Istanbul and will definitely be returning soon. In the meantime, if i have any friends traveling to Turkey, i will absolutely suggest that they stay at the House Hotel Bosphourous as i know it will make for a memorable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jennyuk_11
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Istanbul and we had asked friends for suggestions of hotels and decided that we would like to stay on the Bosphorus. As soon as we arrived we were met by friendly and efficient staff who took us to our beautiful room overlooking the Bosphorus. The decor was lovely and the glass walls of the bathroom meant that the room hadnt lost its identity. My only criticism was not enough drawer space since we were away from home for 2 weeks but sufficient for a long weekend. I was a little concerned at the thought of the hotel being noisy but the double glazing was so effective that my husband had no idea that we were near a busy night spot. Alp and his colleagues were extremely helpful in recommending restaurants and places to visit. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel, it may be a little pricey but in my view it was worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, cool spot, beware rate confirmation!”
Reviews.Author: Mary3737
Reviews.Content: We booked the House Hotel a bit late and were stuck paying about $500.00 USD a night for a tiny room with no view. (Considered "standard"). Albeit a clean and nicely appointed room, comfy beds, great baths, but absolutely no space and no view. We were actually happy to have been shoved to the back of the hotel because the nightlife noise, disco music and city lights were blaring all night on the Bosphorus side. Upon arrival, we met friends upstairs in the restaurant and had a table overlooking the Bosphorus, the food was good and the service was excellent. The Breakfast was very good, in a beautiful setting (the same restaurant as dinner the night before). For dinner the next night, we dined downstairs at the Soho type restaurant and the food and service was excellent. It was loaded with 'chic' people, the ambiance was great. The location was perfect, as long as you did not have to travel there from the airport. The traffic in this area is horrendous. This is the area to be for the locals in the evenings and especially on weekends. It took us 2 hours to get to the hotel on a Thursday night from the airport, it took us 30 minutes to return to the airport on a Saturday morning, early. Erdhem at the front desk was very helpful and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Bahar is the best!”
Reviews.Author: OleMarky
Reviews.Content: Fantastic little boutique hotel that sits right on the Bosphorus in an area called Ortakoy that sits just apart from downtown Istanbul. It's within striking distance of great nightlife and restaurants. Location aside, however, what really makes this place standout is the lovely general manager Bahar Karaca, who wonderfully handled all of our dinner and nightlife reservations from start to finish. Saved us a lot of time and energy we would've spent otherwise pouring over guidebooks and websites. She even made great recommendations for us in Bodrum and Cappadoccia as well. Highly recommend this hotel if you're looking for a boutique spot apart from the crowds that offers great personalized service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully trendy and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Nick of Paris
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, trendy and friendly place (manager Bahar is incredibly professional and efficient). The room aren't big but perfectly organized. The breakfast area is superb and food OK (though not incredible). The gym is minimal (for those who care). The only issue is noise: the hotel is located in a lively and trendy part of the city - so be prepared !

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hip hotel with fantastic views on the Bosphorus.”
Reviews.Author: roadtrip222
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, if you don't require much sleep. The rooms with the views on the Bosphorus are not sound proof at the least. The music from the restuarant downstairs and very popular club next door didn't stop until around 2 am, thereafter the cleaning trucks came in to do their job, and then finally the first prayers from the mosque next door started at 4am. Our delux room was really well designed, even if the bathroom was a tad on the small side. Free wireless in the room and the complementary additional bed for our 3 years, were nice touches for us travelling with a toddler. The breakfast buffet included in the room price was really good and the view from the lounge stunning. All this hotel needs is to improve its sound proofing in their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel on the water”
Reviews.Author: Pilar H
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights (celebrating our wedding anniversary) at the House Hotel Bosphorous in August and had the best vacation ever. The hotel manager Bahar Karaca couldn't be more helpful, she went overboard with all her advice on where to go, dine or shop and made our stay even more enjoyable as we felt like locals. The hotel room was beautiful, extremely clean, with lots of details like modern chandeliers, automated curtains, that makes you feel at a luxury boutique hotel. The bathroom was all marble, modern fixtures, and L'Occitane toiletteries. The bed was modern and sheets were soft (I am picky with hotel beds &sheets) , and came with a Nespresso coffee maker. The rooms are small , but charming (European style). The hotel has it's own character, with an amazing terrace overlooking the Bosphorous (breakfast included). The staff is incredibly helpful from the reception area, restaurant staff , maid service. I give a rate of 100. Congratulations on a job well done!

Reviews.Title: “Great design and front of house, noise and unacceptable business practices”
Reviews.Author: sj_6243
Reviews.Content: I was hoping to write a glowing review of the hotel, but am now very annoyed that I am unable to get a refund on a mistaken charge. Positives: - Lovely design. Modern with character. Great amenities in the room (fancy coffee, bottled water, toiletries, etc.) Room was spacious (we upgraded, but saw the standard room which was perfectly adequately sized. - Great location. Ortakoy has a great neighborhood feel, with great places to eat and a lot of life. You need to be comfortable doing a fair amount of walking. - Wonderful, friendly, accommodating staff. We arrived very early and they allowed us to stay in an empty room until our room was available. I left my passport in that room, and they worked hard to find it. I had some good chats with the people at the front desk. - Great restaurant - expensive but worth it. The free hotel breakfast was very good as well. Negatives: - I was mistakenly charged a $300 deposit that wasn't credited to my final bill. That part I didn't mind. What I do mind is it's almost a month later, and no sign of credit on my bill, and the hotel hasn't responded to my emails for two weeks. That makes me irate. I am a few days away from contesting through my credit card, which I should not have to do, especially for a hotel of this calibre/cost. They really need to improve their business practices in this regard. - The noise. I actually like a bit of street noise, but the room was literally thumping on Friday night at 2 AM, with music coming from the DJ at the hotel bar. - The balconies need to be included in the maid service. I paid significantly more to have a room with a balcony, and it was covered in bird poop. - There was a bit of a sewage-y smell in the room. - Tiny closets.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: traveller320
Reviews.Content: My stay at the House Hotel Bosphorus could not have been better! It is the perfect hotel for trendy, young, good looking people who are looking explore Istanbul during the day and night. The hotel is situated in one of the trendiest & most central areas of Istanbul making it extremely easy to get around the city, as well as convenient to go to all of the best restaurants and night spots. Most importantly, the hotel was clean, comfortable, and chic. The service was impeccable...the hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I would most certainly stay here again & highly recommend it to all!

Reviews.Title: “A Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: may f
Reviews.Content: The hotel was everything we had expected in a small boutique type hotel and the view was spectacular! I had particularly requested a room with a view. But the first night was a veritable nightmare as our room did not have double glazed windows, so the noise from the club next door kept us up till the early hours of the morning. We are used to sleeping in absolute quiet, so it was distressing to hear the thumping music, especially the heavy bass, that seemed interminable. The next day, they fixed the windows, and it was much better, although it could still be further improved; how I have no idea, short of closing down the club next door!! (I had to buy earplugs to sleep). Having said that, the staff was excellent, breakfast with a fabulous view of the Bosphorus was the best way to start the day, and after a hectic day of sight-seeing, it was always a joy to go back to our room and to enjoy the therapeutic sight that greeted us. I would love to recommend the hotel to my friends (Istanbul is becoming a very popular destination), but I'm just afraid that they might have a problem with the noise next door. Without it, this would be THE perfect hotel in Istanbul for me.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sferringto
Reviews.Content: Did not know what to expect from my first trip to Turkey. The staff were very welcoming and helpful. The room was very comfortable and had the most spectacular view. There was so much to see and so much going on that I could just sit and watch and be entertained. The breakfast was probably my favorite part of the stay there. The view from the dining area was unobstructed and breathtaking. My next favorite part was the playlist they had. We had a blast in the restaurant and met so many people from all over the world. I love boutique hotels and this one was very special. Not too big, not too small. I would highly recommend this place and will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: mashmoom
Reviews.Content: I do love these kind of boutique hotels and their location , the House Hotel Bosphorus has prime locations in Istanbul in an area called Ortukoi , the area is full of life day and night , full of cafes , restaurants and crowd you always feel in company even if you are alone . The location of the hotel is so great with a wonderful sea view , i loved the view from the hotel lounge where you can have your meals especially breakfast in front of the sea and enjoy your turkish coffee . the rooms are too small , modern and convenient but at the end of the day you only need your room is for bed time . One thing i didn't like was the noise that you hear at night in your room ,the noise was disturbing only week ends Friday and Saturday night . They've started working on tripling the windows of the hotel to be extra sound proof . The food and service are excellent . Suitable for couples , friends and solo . The surrounding area are full of life and vibrant .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect night in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: stephaniecybele
Reviews.Content: This was without doubt, the best hospitality and hotel (most professional and special) that my husband and I experienced during our 2.5 weeks in Turkey. With the restaurant, bar and transport recommendations and booking assistance we received, we had the perfect end to our stay in Turkey. The hotel was breathtaking - the location, the view, the rooms, the decor/interior design, the food and attention-to-detail - all surpassed our expectations. All of the staff we encountered were friendly, well-trained, polite, knowledgeable and willing to help out to make our time as enjoyable as possible. We hope to return one day and highly recommend the House Hotel Bosphorus to anyone who is looking to experience the the coolest and classiest luxury hotel that Istanbul has to offer. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “A spectacular view and fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: MissSwan79
Reviews.Content: The House Hotel has only recently opened, so we had limited information to rely on when we made the booking. But to our delight, it was everything we had hoped it would be and teething issues were at a minimum. The building itself is a period building which has been beautifully restored within the constraints inevitably placed on listed buildings. We were greeted on arrival by the manager, Alp, who made us feel instantly welcome and was always on hand to help us throughout our four night stay. The hotel is right on the Bosphorus with views of the Bosphorus Bridge, the Maiden Tower, Topkapi Palace (in the distance) and the myriad passing ships. These views are the equal of those from the hotel's neighbours, the renowned Kempinski and the Four Seasons. The hotel has its own very good restaurant but it also sits atop the trendy House Cafe (same owners, apparently), which always has a great buzz. Next door is Banyan, an excellent Asian fusion restaurant with an amazing bar, which by itself is a powerful draw for an early (or late) evening cocktail. The location (Ordakoy) is great, first for the views but also if you enjoy a bit of atmosphere, as it's a popular area for eating, walking or just hanging out by the Bosphorus. However, if you're looking for peace and tranquility, you might prefer elsewhere. Also worth mentioning is the pleasure of waking up to enjoy a delicious breakfast on the restaurant balcony looking directly onto the Bosphorus. None of this would matter, of course, if the service did not live up to the hotel and its surroundings but it did. The staff, led by Alp, a true gentleman, was always friendly and helpful. We definitely expect to stay here again on future stays in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Concept, location and view...”
Reviews.Author: NYC_LONDON_travel
Reviews.Content: Handsome property retaining the original details while enhancing it with new features. Perfect location, right in the thick of it. Oh, and what a view.... Doesn't matter if you're heading off for a party weekend, or a romantic getaway The House Hotel is ideal... I just realised that this sounds too much like an official hotel review, but the hotel is worth every penny...
